author: National Bureau
text:
The government on Monday unveiled a concerted action plan to reduce road accidents by half, by mandating safety air bags in all passenger vehicles, spending Rs. 11,000 crore to fix fatal road spots and cracking down on bogus driving licences.

Union Minister for Road, Transport and Highways, Nitin Gadkari, said on Monday that Centre would spend Rs.11,000 crore in the next five years to fix 726 black spots identified on National Highways.

Black spots are locations that have a record of a large number of accidents.

The Minister said a strict driving licensing system would be put in place as around 30 per cent of the licences in the country were bogus.
title: Rs. 11,000 cr. for road safety
